[[File:US Navy 020623-N-5329L-007 Signalman 2nd Class Eric Palmer signals the U.S. Navy mine hunter coastal ship USS Raven (MHC 61.jpg|thumb| A naval [[signal lamp]], a form of optical communication that uses shutters and is typically employed with [[Morse code]] (2002)]]
'''Optical communication''', also known as '''optical telecommunication''', is [[communication]] at a distance using [[light]] to carry information. It can be performed visually or by using [[electronics|electronic devices]]. The earliest basic forms of optical communication date back several millennia, while the earliest electrical device created to do so was the [[photophone]], invented in 1880.
An optical [[communication system]] uses a [[transmitter]], which encodes a [[message]] into an optical [[signal (information theory)|signal]], a [[Communication channel|channel]], which carries the signal to its destination, and a [[Tuner (radio)|receiver]], which reproduces the message from the received optical signal. When electronic equipment is not employed the 'receiver' is a person visually observing and interpreting a signal, which may be either simple (such as the presence of a [[beacon|beacon fire]]) or complex (such as lights using color codes or flashed in a [[Morse code]] sequence).
[[Free-space optical communication]] has been deployed in space, while terrestrial forms are naturally limited by geography, weather and the availability of light. This article provides a basic introduction to different forms of optical communication.
== Forms == Visual techniques such as [[smoke signals]], [[beacon|beacon fires]], [[hydraulic telegraph]]s, [[ship flags]] and [[semaphore line]]s were the earliest forms of optical communication.<ref name="Burns2004">[https://books.google.com/books?id=7eUUy8-VvwoC&pg=PA29 Chapter 2: Semaphore Signalling] {{ISBN|978-0-86341-327-8}} Communications: an international history of the formative years R. W. Burns, 2004</ref><ref name="EncyBrit1824">[https://books.google.com/books?id=MsYnAAAAMAAJ&pg=PA645 Telegraph] Vol 10, Encyclopædia Britannica, 6th Edition, 1824 pp. 645-651</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.nps.gov/fire/utility/uti_tl_perspectivestext.cfm |title=Nation Park Service Fire History Timeline}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://lewisandclarkjournals.unl.edu/read/?_xmlsrc=1805-07-20.xml&_xslsrc=LCstyles.xsl |title=Lewis and Clark Journals, July 20, 1805}}</ref> Hydraulic telegraph semaphores date back to the 4th century BCE Greece. [[Distress flare]]s are still used by mariners in emergencies, while [[lighthouse]]s and [[navigation light]]s are used to communicate navigation hazards.
The [[heliograph]] uses a [[mirror]] to [[Reflection (physics)|reflect]] sunlight to a distant observer.<ref name="Boer">Harris, J.D. [http://rapidttp.com/milhist/vol111jh.html Wire At War - Signals communication in the South African War 1899–1902]. Retrieved on 1 June 2008. Note a discussion on the heliograph use during the Boer War.</ref> When a signaler tilts the mirror to reflect sunlight, the distant observer sees flashes of light that can be used to transmit a prearranged signaling code. [[Navy|Naval]] [[ship]]s often use [[signal lamp]]s and [[Morse code]] in a similar way.
[[Aviator|Aircraft pilots]] often use [[visual approach slope indicator]] (VASI) projected light systems to land safely, especially at night. Military aircraft landing on an [[aircraft carrier]] use a similar system to land correctly on a carrier deck. The coloured light system communicates the aircraft's height relative to a standard landing [[glideslope]]. As well, [[Air traffic control#Airport control|airport control towers]] still use [[Aldis lamp]]s to transmit instructions to aircraft whose radios have failed.
In the present day a variety of electronic systems optically transmit and receive information carried by pulses of light. [[Fiber-optic communication]] cables are now employed to send the great majority of the electronic data and long distance telephone calls that are not conveyed by either [[radio]], [[Microwave transmission|terrestrial microwave]] or [[Communications satellite|satellite]]. [[Free-space optical communication]]s are also used every day in various applications.
=== Semaphore line === {{Main|Semaphore line}} [[File:OptischerTelegraf.jpg|thumb|left|upright|A replica of one of [[Claude Chappe|Chappe's]] [[semaphore tower]]s (18th century).]] A [[Semaphore line|'semaphore telegraph']], also called a 'semaphore line', 'optical telegraph', 'shutter telegraph chain', 'Chappe telegraph', or 'Napoleonic semaphore', is a system used for conveying information by means of visual signals, using towers with pivoting arms or shutters, also known as blades or paddles. Information is encoded by the position of the mechanical elements; it is read when the shutter is in a fixed position.<ref name="EncyBrit1824"/><ref name="EdEnc1832">[https://books.google.com/books?id=VhEbAQAAMAAJ&pg=PA657 Telegraph], Volume 17 of The Edinburgh encyclopaedia, pp. 664-667, 1832 David Brewster, ed.</ref>
Semaphore lines were a precursor of the [[electrical telegraph]]. They were far faster than [[post rider]]s for conveying a message over long distances, but far more expensive and less private than the electrical telegraph lines which would later replace them. The maximum distance that a pair of semaphore telegraph stations can bridge is limited by geography, weather and the availability of light; thus, in practical use, most optical telegraphs used lines of relay stations to bridge longer distances. Each relay station would also require its complement of skilled operator-observers to convey messages back and forth across the line.
The modern design of semaphores was first foreseen by the British [[polymath]] [[Robert Hooke]], who first gave a vivid and comprehensive outline of visual telegraphy in a 1684 submission to the [[Royal Society]]. His proposal (which was motivated by military concerns following the [[Battle of Vienna]] the preceding year) was not put into practice during his lifetime.<ref>Calvert, J.B. [https://web.archive.org/web/20120208081932/http://mysite.du.edu/~jcalvert/railway/semaphor/semhist.htm The Origin of the Railway Semaphore<!-- Bot generated title -->], [[Boston University]], 15 April 2000, Revised 4 May 2007.</ref><ref>McVeigh, Daniel P. [http://www.ilt.columbia.edu/projects/bluetelephone/html/part2.html An Early History of the Telephone: 1664-1865, Part 2<!-- Bot generated title -->], [[Columbia University|Columbia University in The City of New York]], Institute For Learning Technologies, 2000.</ref>
The first operational optical semaphore line arrived in 1792, created by the French engineer [[Claude Chappe]] and his brothers, who succeeded in covering [[France]] with a network of 556 stations stretching a total distance of {{convert|4,800|km}}. It was used for military and national communications until the 1850s.
Many national services adopted signaling systems different from the Chappe system. For example, [[UK|Britain]] and [[Sweden]] adopted systems of shuttered panels (in contradiction to the Chappe brothers' contention that angled rods are more visible). In [[Spain]], the engineer [[Agustín de Betancourt]] developed his own system which was adopted by that state. This system was considered by many experts in Europe better than Chappe's, even in France.
These systems were popular in the late 18th to early 19th century but could not compete with the [[electrical telegraph]], and went completely out of service by 1880.<ref name="Burns2004"/>
=== Semaphore signal flags === {{Main|Flag semaphore}} [[File:020118-N-6520M-011 Semaphore Flags.jpg|thumb|A naval signaler transmitting a message by flag semaphore (2002).]] [[Flag semaphore|Semaphore Flags]] is the system for conveying information at a distance by means of visual signals with hand-held flags, rods, disks, paddles, or occasionally bare or gloved hands. Information is encoded by the position of the flags, objects or arms; it is read when they are in a fixed position.
Semaphores were adopted and widely used (with hand-held [[flag]]s replacing the mechanical arms of [[semaphore line|shutter semaphores]]) in the maritime world in the 19th century. They are still used during [[Underway replenishment|underway replenishment at sea]] and are acceptable for emergency communication in daylight or, using lighted wands instead of flags, at night.
The newer flag semaphore system uses two short poles with square flags, which a signaler holds in different positions to convey letters of the alphabet and numbers. The transmitter holds one pole in each hand, and extends each arm in one of eight possible directions. Except for in the rest position, the flags cannot overlap. The flags are colored differently based on whether the signals are sent by sea or by land. At sea, the flags are colored red and yellow (the [[International maritime signal flags#Letters|Oscar flags]]), while on land, they are white and blue (the [[International maritime signal flags#Letters|Papa flags]]). Flags are not required, they just make the characters more obvious.
=== Optical fiber === {{Main|Fiber-optic communication}} [[Optical fiber]] is the most common type of channel for optical communications. The transmitters in optical fiber links are generally [[light-emitting diode]]s (LEDs) or [[laser diode]]s. [[Infrared]] light, rather than [[visible light]] is used more commonly, because optical fibers transmit infrared wavelengths with less [[attenuation (electromagnetic radiation)|attenuation]] and [[Dispersion (optics)|dispersion]]. The signal encoding is typically simple [[intensity modulation]], although historically optical phase and [[frequency modulation]] have been demonstrated in the lab. The need for periodic [[signal regeneration]] was largely superseded by the introduction of the [[erbium-doped fiber amplifier]], which extended link distances at significantly lower cost.
=== Signal lamps === {{Main|Signal lamp|Aviation light signals}} [[File:TC with light gun.JPG|thumb|left|An [[air traffic control]]ler holding a signal light gun that can be used to direct aircraft experiencing a radio failure (2007).]] [[Signal lamp]]s (such as Aldis lamps), are visual signaling devices for optical communication (typically using Morse code). Modern signal lamps are a focused lamp which can produce a pulse of light. In large versions this pulse is achieved by opening and closing shutters mounted in front of the lamp, either via a manually operated pressure switch or, in later versions, automatically.
With hand held lamps, a [[Curved mirror#Concave mirrors|concave mirror]] is tilted by a trigger to focus the light into pulses. The lamps are usually equipped with some form of optical sight, and are most commonly deployed on naval vessels and also used in airport control towers with coded [[aviation light signals]].
[[Aviation light signals]] are used in the case of a [[NORDO|radio failure]], an [[aircraft]] not equipped with a radio, or in the case of a hearing-impaired pilot. [[Air traffic control]]ers have long used signal light guns to direct such aircraft. The light gun's lamp has a focused bright beam capable of emitting three different colors: red, white and green. These colors may be flashing or steady, and provide different instructions to aircraft in flight or on the ground (for example, "cleared to land" or "cleared for takeoff"). Pilots can acknowledge the instructions by wiggling their plane's wings, moving their [[aileron]]s if they are on the ground, or by flashing their [[Aircraft landing lights|landing]] or [[navigation light]]s during night time. Only 12 simple standardized instructions are directed at aircraft using signal light guns as the system is not utilized with [[Morse code]].
=== Photophone === {{Main|Photophone}} The [[photophone]] (originally given an alternate name, [[radiophone]]) is a communication device which allowed for the [[transmission (telecommunications)|transmission]] of speech on a beam of [[light]]. It was invented jointly by [[Alexander Graham Bell]] and his assistant [[Charles Sumner Tainter]] on February 19, 1880, at Bell's 1325 'L' Street laboratory in Washington, D.C.<ref>Bruce 1990, pg. 336</ref><ref name="SDU">Jones, Newell. [http://history.sandiego.edu/gen/recording/ar304.html First 'Radio' Built by San Diego Resident Partner of Inventor of Telephone: Keeps Notebook of Experiences With Bell] {{webarchive|url=https://archive.is/20060904235846/http://history.sandiego.edu/gen/recording/ar304.html |date=2006-09-04 }}, San Diego Evening Tribune, July 31, 1937. Retrieved from the University of San Diego History Department website, November 26, 2009.</ref> Both were later to become full associates in the [[Volta Laboratory and Bureau#Laboratory projects|Volta Laboratory Association]], created and financed by Bell.
On June 21, 1880, Bell's assistant transmitted a wireless voice telephone message of considerable distance, from the roof of the [[Franklin School (Washington, D.C.)|Franklin School]] to the window of Bell's laboratory, some 213 meters (about 700 ft.) away.<ref>Bruce 1990, pg. 338</ref><ref name="Carson-2007-gvttw">Carson 2007, pg. 76-78</ref><ref name="Groth">Groth, Mike. [http://www.bluehaze.com.au/modlight/GrothArticle1.htm Photophones Revisted], 'Amateur Radio' magazine, [[Wireless Institute of Australia]], Melbourne, April 1987 pp. 12–17 and May 1987 pp. 13–17.</ref><ref name="Mims 1982, p. 11">Mims 1982, p. 11.</ref>
Bell believed the photophone was his most important [[invention]]. Of the 18 [[patent]]s granted in Bell's name alone, and the 12 he shared with his collaborators, four were for the photophone, which Bell referred to as his'' 'greatest achievement''', telling a reporter shortly before his death that the photophone was ''"the greatest invention [I have] ever made, greater than the telephone"''.<ref name="Mims 1982, p. 14">Mims 1982, p. 14.</ref>
The photophone was a precursor to the [[fiber-optic communication]] systems which achieved popular worldwide usage starting in the 1980s.<ref name="Morgan">Morgan, Tim J. "The Fiber Optic Backbone", [[University of North Texas]], 2011.</ref><ref name="AmericanScientist-1984.V72.No1">Miller, Stewart E. "Lightwaves and Telecommunication", ''[[American Scientist]]'', Sigma Xi, The Scientific Research Society, January–February 1984, Vol. 72, No. 1, pp. 66-71, [https://www.jstor.org/stable/i27852430 Issue Stable URL].</ref><ref name="Gallardo+Mims">Gallardo, Arturo; [[Forrest Mims|Mims III, Forrest M.]]. [http://www.mysanantonio.com/default/article/Fiber-optic-communication-began-130-years-ago-783469.php Fiber-optic Communication Began 130 Years Ago], ''[[San Antonio Express-News]]'', June 21, 2010. Accessed January 1, 2013.</ref> The master patent for the photophone ({{US patent|235199}} ''Apparatus for Signalling and Communicating, called Photophone''), was issued in December 1880,<ref name="Groth" /> many decades before its principles came to have practical applications.
=== Free-space optical communication === {{Main|Free-space optical communication |Optical wireless communications}} Free-space optics (FSO) systems are employed for '[[last mile]]' [[telecommunication]]s and can function over distances of several kilometers as long as there is a clear [[Line-of-sight propagation|line of sight]] between the source and the destination, and the optical receiver can reliably decode the transmitted information.<ref>{{cite web |title= A 173-mile 2-way all-electronic optical contact |url= http://www.modulatedlight.org/optical_comms/optical_qso_173mile.html |work= Modulated light web site |author= Clint Turner |date= October 3, 2007 |accessdate= June 28, 2011 }}</ref> Other free-space systems can provide high-data-rate, long-range links using small, low-mass, low-power-consumption subsystems which make them suitable for communications in space.<ref>{{cite web|last=Wilson|first=K.|title=Recent Development in High-Data Rate Optical Communications at JPL|url=http://hdl.handle.net/2014/18156|work=Jet Propulsion Laboratory|publisher=NASA Technical Reports Server|accessdate=4 October 2011}}</ref> Various planned [[Satellite constellation|satellite constellations]] intended to provide global broadband coverage take advantage of these benefits and employ [[laser communication in space|laser communication]] for inter-satellite links between the several hundred to thousand satellites effectively creating a space-based [[optical mesh network]].
More generally, transmission of unguided optical signals is known as [[optical wireless communications]] (OWC). Examples include medium-range [[visible light communication]] and short-distance [[Infrared Data Association|IrDA]], using infrared LEDs.
=== Heliograph === [[Image:Australian Heliograph in Egyptian Desert 1940.png|thumb|right|upright|[[Heliograph]]: Australians using a heliograph in North Africa (1940).]] {{Main|Heliograph}} A [[heliograph]] ({{Lang-el|Ἥλιος}} ''[[helios]]'', meaning "sun", and {{lang|el|γραφειν}} ''[[wikt:-graphy|graphein]]'', meaning "write") is a wireless solar [[telegraph]] that signals by flashes of [[sunlight]] (generally using [[Morse code]]) reflected by a [[mirror]]. The flashes are produced by momentarily pivoting the mirror, or by interrupting the beam with a shutter.
The heliograph was a simple but effective instrument for instantaneous optical communication over long distances during the late 19th and early 20th century. Its main uses were in military, surveys and forest protection work. They were standard issue in the British and Australian armies until the 1960s, and were used by the Pakistani army as late as 1975.<ref name="Boer"/>
==See also== {{Commons category|Optical communication}} * [[Fiber tapping]] * [[Interconnect bottleneck]] * [[Jun-Ichi Nishizawa]] an inventor of optical communication. * [[Modulating retro-reflector]] * [[OECC]] (OptoElectronics and Communications Conference) * [[Optical interconnect]] * [[Opto-isolator]] * [[Parallel optical interface]]
== References == ===Citations=== {{Reflist|2}}
===Bibliography=== {{refbegin|colwidth=30em}} * Alwayn, Vivek. [http://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=170740&seqNum=1&rl=1 Fiber-Optic Technologies], Cisco Press, Apr 23, 2004. * [[List of Boston University people#Guggenheim Fellows|Bruce, Robert V]] ''Bell: Alexander Bell and the Conquest of Solitude'', Ithaca, New York: [[Cornell University|Cornell University Press]], 1990. {{ISBN|0-8014-9691-8}}. * {{ cite book | last = Carson | first = Mary Kay | title = Alexander Graham Bell: Giving Voice To The World | publisher = Sterling Publishing Co., Inc. | location = 387 Park Avenue South, New York, NY 10016 | year = 2007 | series = Sterling Biographies | pages = 76–78 | chapter = | isbn = 978-1-4027-3230-0 | oclc = 182527281 | url = https://books.google.com/books?id=a46ivzJ1yboC }} * [[Forrest Mims|Mims III, Forest M]]. [https://books.google.com/books?id=zoaSp1BJu50C&pg=PA1#v=onepage&q&f=false The First Century of Lightwave Communications], ''Fiber Optics Weekly Update'', Information Gatekeepers, February 10–26, 1982, pp. 6–23. * Paschotta, Rüdiger. [https://www.rp-photonics.com/optical_fiber_communications.html Encyclopedia of Laser Physics and Technology], RP-Photonics.com website, 2012. {{refend}}
== Further reading == * [[Polina Bayvel|Bayvel, Polina]] [https://www.jstor.org/discover/10.2307/2666790 Future High-Capacity Optical Telecommunication Networks], ''Philosophical Transactions: Mathematical, Physical and Engineering Sciences'', Vol. 358, No. 1765, January 2000, Science into the Next Millennium: Young Scientists Give Their Visions of the Future: II. Mathematics, Physics and Engineering, pp. 303–329, stable article URL: https://www.jstor.org/stable/2666790, published by [[The Royal Society]]. * Dilhac, J-M. [http://www.ieeeghn.org/wiki/images/1/17/Dilhac.pdf The Telegraph of Claude Chappe -An Optical Telecommunication Network For The XVIII Century], Toulouse: Institut National des Sciences Appliquées de Toulouse. revision.text:
{{Infobox software | name = Palo | logo = Palo_Logo_2013.png | caption = Palo | developer = Jedox AG | latest release version = 2018.1 | latest release date = {{start date and age|2018|06|04}} | operating system = [[Linux]], [[Microsoft Windows|Windows]] | genre = [[OLAP]] | license = [[GNU General Public License|GPL v2, LGPL]] until v5.1 [[Proprietary software|Proprietary]] from v5.1 | website = {{URL|jedox.com}} }} '''Palo''' is a memory resident multidimensional ([[online analytical processing]] (OLAP) or multidimensional online analytical processing ([[MOLAP]])) [[database]] server and typically used as a [[business intelligence]] tool for [[management accounting|controlling]] and [[budget]]ing purposes with [[spreadsheet]] software acting as the user interface. Beyond the multidimensional data concept, Palo enables multiple users to share one centralised data storage ([[single version of the truth]]).
This type of [[database]] is suitable to handle complex data models for business management and statistics. Apart from multidimensional queries, data can also be written back and consolidated in real-time. To give rapid access to all data, Palo stores them in the memory during run time. The server is available as [[open-source software|open-source]] and [[proprietary software]].
[[Jedox]] was founded by Kristian Raue in 2002 and developed by Jedox AG, a company based in [[Freiburg]], Germany. The firm currently employs approximately 100 people. Kristian Raue's departure from Jedox was announced in June 2014.<ref>[http://www.jedox.com/en/about-jedox/news/kristian-raue-leaves-jedox-ag.html Jedox announces founder's departure] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140606063250/http://www.jedox.com/en/about-jedox/news/kristian-raue-leaves-jedox-ag.html |date=2014-06-06 }}</ref>
==Features== Palo for Excel is an open source [[plug-in (computing)|plug-in]] for [[Microsoft Excel]]. There is also an open source plug-in for [[OpenOffice.org]] named [[PalOOCa]] (discontinued), with Java and web client also available from the JPalo project.<ref>[http://www.jpalo.com/en/ Tools, Consulting and Service for Palo]</ref> Palo can also be integrated into other systems via its client libraries for [[Java (programming language)|Java]], [[PHP]], [[C (programming language)|C]]/[[C++]], or [[.NET Framework]]. It is fairly easy to communicate with Palo OLAP Server, since it uses [[representational state transfer]] (REST).
Starting in October 2008, Palo supports [[XML for Analysis]] and [[MultiDimensional eXpressions]] (MDX) APIs for connectivity, and [[OLE DB for OLAP]] interface which allows standard Excel pivot tables to serve as a client tool.<ref>{{cite web |title=Palo Open Source OLAP Server now supports MDX and Excel Pivot Tables |url=http://www.tdan.com/view-articles/10965}}</ref> Starting September 2011, Palo supports [http://ssasefprovider.codeplex.com/wikipage?title=sdx&referringTitle=Glossary SDX] dialect of [[LINQ]].
Palo also provides a web-based spreadsheet interface called Palo Web.<ref>[http://www.palo.net/index.php?id=5 Palo Web] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120720170024/http://www.palo.net/index.php?id=5 |date=2012-07-20 }}</ref>
==Architecture== Palo Suite is a tightly integrated framework consisting of: Palo MOLAP Server, Palo ETL Server, Palo Web (Palo Spreadsheet - Connection, User, ETL, File and Report Manager), Palo for Excel, Palo Supervision Server and the Palo Client Libraries.
The Data in Palo database is stored as a cube in the Palo MOLAP server. The Palo Excel Add-In component is used as a service to communicate between the Excel and the Palo MOLAP Server.
==Licensing== Jedox announced only commercial licensing is available since 5.1 version (2015).
==See also== {{Portal|Free software}} * [[MOLAP]] * [[Business intelligence]] * [[Performance management]] * [[Comparison of OLAP Servers]]
==References== {{Reflist}}
===Additional sources=== * Bernd Held, Hartmut Erb: ''Advanced Controlling mit Excel. Unternehmenssteuerung mit OLAP und PALO, m. CD-ROM.'', Franzis, Poing 2006, {{ISBN|978-3-7723-7585-9}} (in German) * Stefan Müller, Leif Mergener: ''Business Intelligence im Vertrieb auf Basis von Open-Source-Lösungen.'' In: Ronald Gleich, Andreas Klein (Hrsg.): Marketing- und Vertriebs-Controlling (Der Controlling-Berater Bd. 11). Haufe-Lexware, Freiburg 2010, {{ISBN|978-3-648-00489-0}}. (in German) * [https://web.archive.org/web/20131221053917/http://www.jedox.com/en/jedox-downloads/jedox-documentation-archive.html Palo Documentation] - Documentation to Palo (pdf) in the download section of the website * [http://knowledgebase.jedox.com Online Knowledgebase] Free Online Knowledgebase with full-text search and export as PDF functionality * [http://feedback.jedox.com Feature Voting Tool] Feedback/Feature Voting Tool * [http://www.b-eye-network.co.uk/view-articles/6759 ''b-eye network'' article] - Open Source OLAP in the Retail Environment. John Hobson, February 2008
==External links== * {{Official website|jedox.com}} * {{sourceforge|palo}} * [https://www.ohloh.net/p/p4155/ Palo project page on ohloh.net] - Palo project page on ohloh.net
[[Category:Online analytical processing]] [[Category:Business intelligence]]

{{Lowercase title}} {{Infobox company | name = paysafecard Wertkarten GmbH | logo = Paysafecard logo.svg | type = [[Private limited company]] | traded_as = | industry = [[E-commerce payment system|Online payments]] | foundation = 2000 | location = [[Vienna]], Austria | key_people = [[CEO]] Udo Müller | products = [[Electronic money]] | revenue = [[Euro|€]]191.6 million (2016)<ref name=ALC2016>{{cite web |url=https://diepresse.com/unternehmen/alc/5315617/Alle-Rankings-von-Austrias-Leading-Companies |title=Alle Rankings von Austria's Leading Companies |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=22 November 2017 |publisher=[[Die Presse]] |access-date=22 December 2017 |language=German |trans-title=All Rankings of Austria's Leading Companies}}</ref> | operating_income= | net_income = | num_employees = 245 (2016)<ref name=ALC2016 /> | parent = [[Paysafe Group]] | subsid = | homepage = [https://www.paysafecard.com/ paysafecard] }} '''paysafecard''' is a prepaid [[E-commerce payment system|online payment]] method based on vouchers with a 16-digit [[Personal Identification Number|PIN]] code, independent of bank account, credit card, or other personal information. Customers can purchase vouchers at local sales outlets and pay online by entering the code at the checkout of the respective website (e. g. an online game). paysafecard codes are ''not'' designated to be passed by mail or telephone.
paysafecard is issued and distributed country-wise; cross-border and cross-currency usage is possible within some limits. The scope of services and partner webshops varies by country. In most countries, a personal account called ''my paysafecard'' for uploading PINs is available. Starting in [[Austria]] in 2000, as of 2018 paysafecard is available in over 40 countries. Two former competitors, Dutch ''Wallie'' and British [[Ukash]], have been absorbed into paysafecard.
In 2013, paysafecard was acquired by British [[digital wallet]] provider [[Skrill]], and in 2015 as part of the Skrill Group by the ''Optimal Payments Group'', an global online payment processing provider regulated in the [[United Kingdom]]. Optimal Payments subsequently rebranded as [[Paysafe Group]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://cardnotpresent.com/optimal-payments-rebrands-as-paysafe-nov-12-2015/ |title=Optimal Payments Rebrands as Paysafe |last=Leibovitch |first=Daniel |date=12 November 2015 |website=cardnotpresent.com |access-date=26 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.ewallet-optimizer.com/paysafecard-details-and-information/ |title=Paysafecard – Details & Information |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=ewallet-optimizer.com |access-date=11 February 2018}}</ref>
== Name: paysafecard and Paysafe == While the brand name of the payment method has always been ''paysafecard'', in practice it is often shortened to "Paysafe",<ref name="Doerner">{{cite web |url=https://www.handelsblatt.com/technik/it-internet/hacker-foren-missbrauch-von-paysafe/6799580-3.html |title=Im Untergrund-Netz der Cyber-Kriminellen - Missbrauch von Paysafe |last=Dörner |first=Stephan |date=27 June 2012 |website= |publisher=Handelsblatt |access-date=20 December 2017 |language=German |trans-title=In the Underground Network of Cyber Criminals: Abuse of Paysafe}}</ref><ref name="computerbetrug">{{cite web |url=http://www.computerbetrug.de/2013/01/ukash-und-paysafe-betruger-nehmen-tankstellen-ins-visier-7229 |title=Ukash und Paysafe: Betrüger nehmen Tankstellen ins Visier |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=2 January 2012 |website=computerbetrug.de |access-date=29 December 2017 |language=German |trans-title=Ukash und Paysafe: Fraudsters target gas stations}}</ref> the "card" part also being translated into other languages.<ref name="AK">{{cite web |url=http://vorarlberg.orf.at/news/stories/2581219/ |title=AK warnt vor Betrug mit Paysafe-Karten |author=<!--not mentioned--> |date=23 April 2013 |website=orf.at |publisher=[[ORF (broadcaster)]] |access-date=21 December 2017 |quote= |language=German |trans-title=Austrian Chamber of Labour Warns of Fraud with Paysafe-Cards}}</ref><ref name="vectone">{{cite web |url=https://www.vectonemobile.at/hilfe/guthaben-aufladen-mit-paysafecard |title=Guthaben aufladen mit paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=vectonemobile.at |access-date=23 December 2017 |quote=Paysafekarten |language=German |trans-title=Recharge your balance with paysafecard }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.casino.gr/deposit-options/paysafe-cards |title=Κάρτες Paysafe |last=Ioannides |first=Lydia |date=24 September 2010 |website=casino.gr |access-date=23 December 2017 |language=Greek |trans-title=Paysafe cards }}</ref>
In 2015, paysafecard became a part of the multinational ''Optimal Payments'' online payment corporation, which subsequently rebranded as [[Paysafe Group]]. The group now directly offers certain products and services under the ''Paysafe'' brand. paysafecard, however, continues to be a subsidiary brand of the Paysafe Group in its own right, alongside some others, like the digital wallets [[Skrill]] and [[Neteller]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.paysafe.com/paysafegroup/paysafe-group-homepage/ |title=Welcome to Paysafe Group |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=paysafe.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref>
Some sources erreneously interpret ''Paysafe'' to be the name of the company originally issuing the ''paysafecard'' product, and sometimes suggest this to be the core company of the Paysafe Group.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.brokervergleich.net/ripple-kaufen-mit-paysafe |title=Ripple kaufen mit Paysafe |last= |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=brokervergleich.net |access-date=22 December 2017|quote= |language=German |trans-title=Buy Ripple With Paysafe}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.ewallet-optimizer.com/skrill/paysafe-group-plc/ |title=Paysafe Group PLC History |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=ewallet-optimizer.com |access-date=26 January 2018 |quote=Paysafe started in 2000 with four Austrians who developed “cash for the internet” and named their product paysafecard.}}</ref>
== Geographical extension == As of 2018 paysafecard is issued in over 40 countries—covering most of [[Europe]] and [[North America]], [[Australia]] and [[New Zealand]], and some countries in [[Western Asia]] and [[South America]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.about-payments.com/knowledge-base/method/paysafecard#countries |title=Payment Method Profile: paysafecard - Available in the Following Countries |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=about-payments.com |access-date=3 July 2018}}</ref>
Countries with paysafecard available include [[Argentina]], [[Australia]], [[Austria]], [[Belgium]], [[Bulgaria]], [[Canada]], [[Croatia]], [[Cyprus]], the [[Czech Republic]], [[Denmark]], [[Finland]], [[France]], [[Georgia (country)|Georgia]], [[Germany]], [[Greece]], [[Hungary]], [[Ireland]], [[Italy]], [[Kuwait]], [[Latvia]], [[Lithuania]], [[Luxembourg]], [[Malta]], [[Mexico]], the [[Netherlands]], [[New Zealand]], [[Norway]], [[Peru]], [[Poland]], [[Portugal]], [[Romania]], [[Saudi-Arabia]], [[Slovakia]], [[Slovenia]], [[Spain]], [[Sweden]], [[Switzerland]], [[Turkey]], the [[United Arab Emirates]],<ref name="paypers">{{cite web |url=https://www.thepaypers.com/online-payments/paysafecard-enters-uae-online-payments-market/769655-3 |title=Paysafecard enters UAE online payments market |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=1 August 2017 |website=thepaypers.com |access-date=22 December 2017}}</ref><ref name="casinodubai">{{cite web |url=https://onlinecasinodubai.net/paysafecard/ |title=Paysafecard Casino Deposits |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=onlinecasinodubai.net |publisher= |access-date= |quote=23 December 2017}}</ref> the [[United Kingdom]], the [[United States]] and [[Uruguay]].<ref name="riotgames">{{cite web |url=https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201753064-paysafecard |title=Riot Games Support, Payment Methods: paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |date= |publisher=[[Riot Games]] |access-date=22 December 2017}}</ref>
== Acceptance == Web offers payable with paysafecard include [[online game]]s, [[social media]], telecommunication,<ref name="vectone" /> music,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mobiflip.de/spotify-premium-ab-sofort-auch-mit-paysafecard-bezahlbar/ |last=Kemper |first=Jonathan |title=Spotify Premium ab sofort auch mit Paysafecard bezahlbar |website=mobiflip.de |date=16 January 2015 |access-date=6 January 2018 |language=German |trans-title=Spotify Premium from now on also payable with paysafecard}}</ref> and others. The scope of websites accepting paysafecard varies per country for several reasons. The most widespread use are online games; for example, [[League of Legends]] accepts paysafecard in 41 countries as of 2018.<ref name="riotgames" /> Examples of other partners accepting paysafecard in 20 or more countries include [[PlayStation 4]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.playstation.com/en-gb/get-help/help-library/store---transactions/payments---refunds/how-to-use-playstation-4-to-top-up-your-wallet-with-paysafecard/ |title=PS4: Top up wallet with Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=25 August 2017 |website=playstation.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref> [[Steam (software)|Steam]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://store.steampowered.com/news/4203/ |title=Use Paysafecard on Steam and Receive a Free Copy of Portal |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=19 August 2010 |website=steampowered.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref> [[Guild Wars]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.guildwars2.com/en/news/paysafecard-now-accepted-in-gem-store/ |title=paysafecard Now Accepted in Gem Store |author=The Guild Wars 2 Team |date=27 February 2013 |website=guildwars2.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref> [[Second Life]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://community.secondlife.com/knowledgebase/english/list-of-accepted-payment-methods-by-country-r1396/ |title=List of accepted payment methods by country |last=Linden |first=Jeremy |website=secondlife.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref> [[Skype]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://support.skype.com/en/faq/FA12323/how-can-i-pay-for-skype |title=How can I pay for Skype? |author=<!-- not stated--> |publisher=[[Skype]] |access-date=22 June 2018 }} - lists paysafecard as a payment method in Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, the United Kingdom and the United States</ref> [[Facebook]]<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.facebook.com/help/203680236341574 |title=What payment methods can I use on Facebook games? |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=facebook.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref> and [[Newegg]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://kb.newegg.com/knowledge-base/international-payment-methods/ |title=International payment methods |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=8 June 2018 |website=newegg.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref>
==History== === Early years === The company behind paysafecard is based in [[Vienna]], Austria, and was founded in 2000 as ''paysafecard.com Wertkarten AG'' ("paysafecard.com prepaid card Inc."), later transferred into a [[Gesellschaft mit beschränkter Haftung|GmbH]], a [[private limited company]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://trademarks.justia.com/790/76/paysafecard-pay-cash-pay-79076910.html |title=PAYSAFECARD PAY CASH. PAY SAFE. - Trademark Details |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=4 January 2018 |website=trademarks.justitia.com |access-date=3 July 2018}}</ref> Technical partner providing expertise and the original hardware was [[IBM]] Austria.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www-07.ibm.com/services/pdf/paysafecardcom_makes_web_shopping_simple_secure.pdf |title=paysafecard.com makes Web shopping simple, secure, private |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=2001 |website=ibm.com |publisher=[[IBM]] |access-date=April 4, 2018 |format=PDF}}</ref> The following year, paysafecard launched also in Germany.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.heise.de/newsticker/meldung/Internet-Prepaid-Karte-ab-heute-erhaeltlich-38559.html |title=Internet-Prepaid-Karte ab heute erhältlich |last=Dambeck |first=Holger |date=5 June 2001 |website=heise.de |publisher=[[Heinz Heise]] |access-date=24 May 2018 |language=German |trans-title=paysafecard obtainable as from today}}</ref>
In 2005, paysafecard received an EU funding under the ''eTEN'' program supporting electronic services with a trans-European dimension.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.die-wirtschaft.at/die-wirtschaft/long-road-102386 |title=The Long Road |last=Hornacek |first=Harald |date=28 November 2005 |website=die-wirtschaft.at |access-date=22 December 2017 |language=German }}</ref> Subsequently, paysafecard launched in Slovenia, Greece, Slovakia, Spain and the United Kingdom.<ref name ="finextra2006">{{cite web |url=https://www.finextra.com/newsarticle/15783/pre-paid-paysafecard-set-for-launch-in-uk |title=Pre-paid Paysafecard set for launch in UK |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=30 August 2006 |website=finextra.com |access-date=24 May 2018 }}</ref> In 2008, British subsidiary ''Prepaid Services Company Ltd.'' received an EU-wide e-money licence by the [[Financial Services Authority|British Financial Services Authority (FSA)]], later the [[Financial Conduct Authority|Financial Conduct Authority (FCA)]] under the [[Financial Services and Markets Act 2000]],<ref name ="fca">{{cite web |url=https://register.fca.org.uk/ShPo_FirmDetailsPage?id=001b000000m4IWxAAM |title=Firm Details: Prepaid Services Company Limited |author=<!-- not stated--> |publisher=[[Financial Conduct Authority]] |access-date=28 January 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.fsa.gov.uk/register/firmBasicDetails.do?sid=194647 |title=Basic details for: 475502 - Prepaid Services Company Limited |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=1 July 2011 |publisher=FSA |access-date=30 January 2018 |archive-url=https://archive.is/lfoM#selection-191.0-195.41 |archive-date=23 December 2012 }}</ref> expanding a ''small e-money issuers certificate'' valid for the United Kingdom in 2006.<ref name ="finextra2006" /> This authorised the company to issue e-money throughout the [[European Union]].<ref>{{cite web |title=paysafecard erhält EU-Lizenz zur Ausgabe von elektronischem Geld |author=<!-- not stated--> |publisher=[[Der Standard]]|url=http://derstandard.at/3361758/paysafecard-erhaelt-EU-Lizenz-zur-Ausgabe-von-elektronischem-Geld |accessdate=22 December 2015 |date=12 June 2008}}</ref> Also in 2008, paysafecard Switzerland obtained a license as a financial intermediary.<ref>{{cite web|title=paysafecard expandiert in die Schweiz|publisher=pctipp.ch|url=http://www.pctipp.ch/news/firmen/artikel/paysafecard-expandiert-in-die-schweiz-42406/|accessdate=22 December 2015 |first=Bruno|last=Habegger|date=21 February 2008|language=German}}</ref>
=== Acquisitions === In August 2011, paysafecard absorbed Dutch competitor Wallie.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.about-payments.com/newsroom/news/1284/paysafecard-acquires-online-payment-provider-wallie |title=paysafecard acquires online payment provider Wallie |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=7 September 2011 |website=about-payments.com |access-date=25 June 2018}}</ref> In February 2013, [[Moneybookers|Skrill]], one of the largest payment services providers in Europe completed the acquisition of paysafecard.com Wertkarten AG.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.retail-systems.com/rs/Skrill_paysafecard.php |title=Skrill acquires paysafecard.com |last=Moss |first=Karen |date=11 February 2013 |website=retail-systems.com |access-date=25 June 2018 }}</ref> In November 2014, Skrill acquired British paysafecard competitor [[Ukash]] and merged it into paysafecard.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.techworld.com/news/apps-wearables/skrill-extends-payments-portfolio-with-ukash-acquisition-3589087/ |title=Skrill extends payments portfolio with Ukash acquisition |last=Finnegan |first=Matthew |date=28 November 2014 |website=techworld.com |access-date=25 June 2018}}</ref><ref name="doubleAcquisition">{{cite web |url=http://www.onlinepaymentsreview.com/news/18-skrill-acquires-ukash-optimal-payments-acquires-skrill |title=Skrill acquires Ukash, Optimal Payments acquires Skrill |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=14 July 2015 |website=onlinepaymentsreview.com |access-date=25 June 2018}}</ref> In August 2015, Skrill group competitor ''Optimal Payments'' group completed the acquisition of Skrill group, including paysafecard, and subsequently rebranded as ''Paysafe Group''.<ref name="doubleAcquisition" />
==Functionality== === Basic function === Core of paysafecard is a 16-digit PIN, sold (most usually) on a printout, a pre-printed prepaid card, or as a digital information online. In the respective countries, paysafecard is available in demoninations ranging from 10 to 100 [[euro]]s, [[United States dollar]]s, [[Pound sterling|pounds sterling]], and [[Australian dollar]]s, and approximately equivalent sums in other currencies, e. g. 100-1000 [[Norwegian krone]]r.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.casino.org/no/utbetaling/paysafecard/ |title=Casinoer som tilbyr Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=casino.org |access-date=April 23, 2018 |language=Norwegian |trans-title=Casinos where paysafecard is available}}</ref>
When paying in an online shop, the user enters the 16 digit PIN, and the amount tendered is deducted from the paysafecard balance. Hence, the same PIN code can be used multiple times. For larger sums it is possible to combine up to ten paysafecard PINs.<ref name="binaryoptions">{{cite web |url=https://www.binaryoptions.net/paysafecard-binary-options-brokers/ |title=Paysafecard Binary Options Brokers |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=binaryoptions.net |access-date=April 22, 2018 }}</ref>
The current balance of each paysafecard as well as its transaction history and production date can be viewed at the official site by entering the respective 16 PIN code.
=== Business model and fees === The paysafecard company earns varying proportions of merchants' transaction volumes, shared with the distribution partners.<ref name="seekingalpha">{{cite web |url=https://seekingalpha.com/article/3983936-paysafe-finally-danger-paypals-rear-view-mirror?page=2 |title=Paysafe: Finally A Danger In PayPal's Rear View Mirror! |last=Rusanov |first=Simeon |date=23 June 2016 |website=seekingalpha.com |publisher=[[Seeking Alpha]] |access-date=21 May 2018 }}</ref> They do not charge any fees to the customer for purchasing and using paysafecard, as well as checking the balance of a PIN or its payment history online. Nonetheless, in the following situations fees are to be paid:<ref>{{cite web |url=https://praxistipps.chip.de/was-ist-paysafecard-und-wie-funktioniert-sie_41010 |title=Was ist Paysafecard und wie funktioniert sie? |last=Krug |first=Katharina |date=19 May 2015 |website=chip.de |publisher=[[Chip (magazine)|Chip]] |access-date=2 May 2018 |language=German |trans-title=What is paysafecard and how does it work?}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://praxistipps.chip.de/paysafecard-alle-gebuehren-im-ueberblick_41015 |title=Paysafecard: Alle Gebühren im Überblick |last=Krug |first=Katharina |date=19 May 2015 |website=chip.de |publisher=[[Chip (magazine)|Chip]] |access-date=2 May 2018 |language=German |trans-title=Paysafecard: Overview of all fees }}</ref> * Twelve months after purchasing a paysafecard customers will be charged an administrative fee of €3 (or like sums) on remaining balance per month, which will be automatically deducted from their credit. * A reimbursement of credit remaining on a paysafecard PIN requires the customer to provide their personal details, a copy of a valid form of photographic identification, bank account details and the details of the paysafecard PIN in question. Usually a reimbursement fee will be deducted from the remaining paysafecard credit, in Germany amounting to €7.50. * For payments in a different currency than associated with the PIN obtained, paysafecard will charge a fee of usually 2%.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://support.worldpay.com/support/kb/gg/alternativepayments/content/paysafecard.htm |title=About paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=worldpay.com |access-date=April 22, 2018}}</ref>
=== Issuing === In contrast to in-house vouchers and prepaid products, paysafecard is sold and accepted at distinct companies ("Third Party Billing"). For this reason, dealing with them is a banking transaction and requires either a banking partner or a banking licence. In the beginning, paysafecard was issued by the [[BAWAG P.S.K.]] in Austria and the [[Commerzbank]] in Germany.<ref>[https://books.google.at/books?id=XpneBwAAQBAJ&pg=PA355&lpg=PA355#v=onepage&q&f=false Challenges of Expanding Internet: E-Commerce, E-Business, and E-Government. 2005, Poznan, Poland, p. 355]</ref>
Since 2008, paysafecard's subsidiary company ''Prepaid Services Company Limited'' holds a licence of the [[Financial Conduct Authority]] (resp. its predecessor [[Financial Services Authority]]) "to issue electronic money (e-money) and provide payment services", valid for all countries in the [[European Economic Area]].<ref name ="fca" /> Therefore in those countries, paysafecard is issued by ''Prepaid Services'' without external banking partner. Further, Swiss paysafecard subsidiary ''paysafecard.com Schweiz GmbH'' is a licensed [[financial intermediary]] in Switzerland<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.finma.ch/de/~/media/finma/dokumente/bewilligungstraeger/pdf/dufi.pdf?la=de |title=Liste der bewilligten Finanzintermediäre nach Art. 2 Abs. 3 GwG (DUFI) |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=finma.de |publisher=[[Swiss Financial Market Supervisory Authority]] |format=PDF |access-date=16 March 2018 |quote= |language=DE |trans-title=List of licensed financial intermediaries in accord with Article 2 paragraph 3 Money Laundering Act }}</ref> and issuer of the product also in other countries, e.g. in [[Australia]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://afterpaytouch.com/images/uploads/reports/Paysafe-Card-Terms-and-Conditions.pdf |title=General Terms and Conditions for Use of paysafecards in Australia |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=2013 |website=afterpaytouch.com |publisher=paysafecard |access-date=16 March 2018 |format=PDF}}</ref>
In the United States, payment regulations require an external banking partner issuing paysafecard, a role assumed by ''The Bancorp Bank''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.americanbanker.com/news/austrian-companys-prepaid-alternative-comes-to-the-us-market |title=Austrian Company's Prepaid Alternative Comes to the U.S. Market |last=Hernandez |first=Will |date=19 October 2010 |website=americanbanker.com |publisher=[[American Banker]] |access-date=11 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cbaaonline.com/credit-cards/paysafecard/ |title=PAYSAFECARD |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=cbaaonline.com |access-date=11 March 2018 }}</ref>
=== Distribution === In the beginning, paysafecard was sold as pre-printed [[scratchcard]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.tebiko.de/text.php?tid=171 |title=Verwirrende Vielfalt |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=14 June 2001 |website=tebiko.de |access-date=15 May 2018 |quote=Besitzer der Paysafecard rubbeln auf der Rückseite einen 16-stelligen Zahlencode frei. ("Owners of a Paysafecard reveal the 16-digit number code on the back side by scratching.") |language=German |trans-title=Confusing variety [of online payment methods] }}</ref> Starting in 2002, paysafecards are usually sold as printouts called "eVouchers" by the company, uniquely numbered receipts from in-store sales terminals. paysafecard is distributed country-wise by varying external partners, which is why also shop types offering paysafecard vary by country. Typical examples include newsagents, petrol stations,<ref name="seekingalpha" /><ref name="betrugorg">{{cite web |url=https://www.betrug.org/ripple-kaufen-mit-paysafecard/ |title=Ripple kaufen mit Paysafecard 2018: So erwerben Sie XRP |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=betrug.org |access-date=22 May 2018 |quote= |language=German |trans-title=Buy Ripple with Paysafecard in 2018: So you can buy XRP }}</ref> post offices,<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.postfinance.ch/de/privat/produkte/digital-banking/digitales-guthaben/paysafecard.html |title=Guthaben für paysafecard: Einfach einkaufen ohne Kreditkarten |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=postfinance.ch |publisher=[[PostFinance]] |access-date=22 May 2018 |language=German |trans-title=Balance for paysafecard: Simple shopping without a credit card}}</ref><ref name="betrugorg" /> pharmacies,<ref name="betrugorg" /> supermarkets,<ref name="betrugorg" /> electrical retailers and vending machines.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.sbb.ch/de/bahnhof-services/dienstleistungen/weitere-dienstleistungen/paysafecard.html |title=Mit der paysafecard sicher im Internet einkaufen. |author=<!-- not stated--> |publisher=[[Swiss Federal Railways]] |access-date=2 June 2018 |quote=An allen SBB Billettautomaten rund um die Uhr [at all ticket vending machines 24/7] |language=German |trans-title=Safe online buying with paysafecard }}</ref> The world-wide number of points of sales sums up to 600,000.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.sandlerresearch.org/alternative-payment-solution-paysafecard.html |title=Alternative Payment Solution: paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=sandlerresearch.org |access-date=22 June 2018 }}</ref>
=== Other services === Aside normal paysafecard, the company offers several other services, most notably in most countries an online account called ''my paysafecard'' to upload PINs and to do repeated payments more comfortably.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.ewallet-optimizer.com/paysafecard-details-and-information/ |title=Paysafecard Details and FAQ |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=ewallet-optimizer.com |access-date=12 April 2018}}</ref> At the payment checkout of a webshop, customers may choose between entering a PIN and signing in to their ''my paysafecard'' account.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.securetrading.com//wp-content/uploads/2016/09/STPP-paysafecard.pdf |title=XML Specification Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=15 January 2018 |website=securetrading.com |access-date=9 May 2018 |format=PDF |page=9 }}</ref> The account also includes a loyalty program called ''my PLUS'' - doing payments will earn you points that can be exchanged for different benefits.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.casinoonline.co.nz/banking-options/paysafecard/ |title=All About Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |date= |website=casinoonline.co.nz |access-date=21 June 2018}}</ref>
In several countries, paysafecard also issues a prepaid ''paysafecard [[Mastercard]]''.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.kreditkarten-prepaid.at/paysafe-mastercard-kreditkarte/ |title=PaySafe MasterCard Kreditkarte |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=kreditkarten-prepaid.at |access-date=12 April 2018 |language=German |trans-title=PaySafe MasterCard credit card }}</ref>
== Limitations == paysafecard has limitations manifesting especially when used for online [[gambling]]. Payments (thus also deposits in gambling accounts) with paysafecard are inherently limited to the amount of €1000;<ref name="binaryoptions" /> for classic paysafecard (not ''my paysafecard'') this amount has been lowered to €250 in 2016 due to compliance regulations.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.paysafecard.com/en/business/news/detail/new-maximum-payment-amount-per-transaction-250-euros-my-paysafecard-is-not-affected-1/ |title=New maximum payment amount per transaction: 250 euros – my paysafecard is not affected |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=9 May 2016 |website=paysafecard.com |access-date=22 June 2018}}</ref> Many other online payment methods allow a multiple of those amounts. Also, in contrast to other payment methods, accountless paysafecard does not enable a customer to withdraw money.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.casinobonusesindex.com/banking/paysafecard.html |title=Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=casinobonusesindex.com |publisher= |access-date=21 June 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.vip-bet.com/events-reviews-betting-preview-odds/payment-options/betsson-payment-methods/ |title=Betsson Payment Methods |last=Seregin |first=Kirill |date=November 29, 2017 |website=vip-bet.com |access-date=April 23, 2018}}</ref><ref name="casinodubai" /> However, a withdrawal to ''my paysafecard'' is possible and supported by several online casinos.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.casinotop10.net/paysafecard-online-casinos-review |title=paysafecard online casinos 2018 |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=casinotop10.net |access-date=26 May 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://sirslot.com/withdrawing-casino-paysafecard/ |title=Withdrawing Casino funds to Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=sirslot.com |access-date=25 May 2018 }}</ref>
Unlike credit cards, paysafecard does not give the opportunity to overdraw your fundings, which may be appreciated as a means of spending control.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rouletteonline.net/deposit-methods/paysafecard/ |title=Deposit Via paysafecard to Play Roulette |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=rouletteonline.net |access-date=21 June 2018 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.casino.org/payment/paysafecard/ |title=Top 5 Paysafecard Online Casinos of 2018 - Safe & Secure |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=casino.org |access-date=21 June 2018 }}</ref>
== Security issues == paysafecard is a payment method that enables the customer to stay anonymous not only to the merchants, but also with respect to the payment provider.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://wwwhome.cs.utwente.nl/~pras/publications/2005-I3E-2ndgeneration-payments.pdf |title=Second generation micropayment systems: lessons learned |first=Róbert |last=Párhonyi |first2=Lambert J.M. |last2=Nieuwenhuis |first3=Aiko |last3=Pras |date=2005 |publisher=Department of Computer Science, University of Twente |access-date=26 May 2018 |format=PDF |page=9}}</ref> The amount of money exposed to loss by accident or fraud is limited to the denomination of the voucher purchased; no bank account or credit card data are put at risk.<ref name="rechnungswesen">{{cite web |url=https://www.rechnungswesen-verstehen.de/finanzen/paysafecard.php |title=Wie funktioniert die Paysafecard ? Vorteile, Nachteile, Kosten |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=rechnungswesen-verstehen.de |access-date=26 May 2018 |language=German |trans-title=How does paysafecard work? Advantages, disadvantages, costs}}</ref>
Nonetheless, there are varying instances of abuse: * Like all systems that only require entering data on a website, paysafecard may fall victim to [[phishing]] techniques. By mimicking the official website or a merchant's checkout page, fraudsters may trick users into entering their PINs and use the credit for themselves.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.pc-magazin.de/news/telekom-phishing-rechnung-paysafecard-giropay-warnung-3195445.html |title=Telekom-Phishing: Sichere Zahlungsmöglichkeiten für angebliche Rückstände |last=Nguyen |first=The-Khoa |date= |website= |publisher=10 December 2015 |access-date=12 May 2018 |language=German |trans-title=[[Deutsche Telekom|Telekom]]-Phishing: Secure payment options for pretended arrears}}</ref> A special instance are so-called "paysafecard hacks", allegedly doubling the value of your paysafecard.<ref name="botfrei">{{cite web |url=https://blog.botfrei.de/2012/01/betrugsversuche-mit-der-paysafecard/ |title=Betrugsversuche mit der paysafecard |last= |first= |author=<!-- not stated--> |date=18 January 2012 |website=botfrei.de |access-date=28 May 2018 |language=german |trans-title=Fraud attempts with paysafecard}}</ref> * In common low-tech versions of this phishing, fraudsters offer goods, services, or cash prizes demanding a commitment fee,<ref name="botfrei" /> and ask for paysafecard PINs by mail or phone (or scans of the card) for payment. No goods or services are ever delivered in such cases.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.computerbild.de/artikel/cb-News-Internet-Ebay-Kleinanzeigen-Betrug-Post-17961013.html |title=Ebay-Kleinanzeigen: Das sind die aktuellen Betrugsmaschen |last1=Matthiesen |first1=Nils |last2=Hensen |first2=Christian |date=22 November 2017 |website=computerbild.de |publisher=[[Computer Bild]] |access-date=6 July 2018 |language=German |trans-title=Ebay classified ads: Those are the current fraud scams}}</ref> * In the early 2010s, paysafecard was criticized as being abused by criminals for anonymous payments — by means of uploading prepaid credit cards, including stolen ones.<ref name="Doerner" /> German computer magazine [[Computer Bild]] propagated a quick legal regulation.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.bild.de/digital/internet/zahlungsmittel-abzocke-betrug-kriminelle-14100144.bild.html |title=Paysafecard: Kriminelle nutzen Karte für Abzocke und Betrug |author=<!--not stated--> |date=28 September 2010 |website=bild.de |publisher=Computerbild |access-date=20 December 2017 |language=German |trans-title=Paysafecard: Criminals use card for rip-off and fraud}}</ref> Indeed a new money-laundering law was passed in Germany, effective at the start of 2012. It obliged customers of anonymous prepaid methods (like paysafecard) to undergo an identification procedure when surpassing a monthly spending amount of 100 €.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.heise.de/ix/artikel/Waehrungsrisiken-1723975.html |title=Währungsrisiken |last=Haar |first=Tobias |date=November 2012 |website=heise.de |publisher=[[Heinz Heise]] |access-date=April 22, 2018 |language=German |trans-title=Currency risks}}</ref> * Mainly from 2012 to 2014 cases were reported of fraudsters calling at gas stations, trying to obtain paysafecard PINs from the salespersons by pretending to be paysafecard personnel. Two cases in [[Vorarlberg]], Austria, summed up to over 6000 €.<ref name ="computerbetrug" /><ref name="AK" /> * Starting in 2012, paysafecard and other prepaid payment methods (like then-competitor [[Ukash]] and [[Bitcoin]]) have been abused by [[ransomware (malware)|ransomware]], claiming to originate from the [[Federal Criminal Police Office (Germany)|German Federal Criminal Police Office]]. The ransomware locks customers' computers and may threaten to erase their hard drives, unless a fine is paid. However, computers are not unlocked even when the fine is paid by the customer.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bundes-trojaner.de/ |title=Bundespolizei-, BKA-Trojaner entfernen |author=<!-- not stated--> |date= |website=bundes-trojaner.de |publisher= |access-date=April 22, 2018 |language=German |trans-title=How to remove the 'Federal Criminal Police' trojan}}</ref> paysafecard suggests to remove related viruses and trojans by following instructions provided by Botcrawl.com and other websites.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.paysafecard.com/en-us/security/|title=BKA/GEMA computer virus - demands the payment of a "fine" by paysafecard |accessdate=13 October 2014}}</ref><ref name="botfrei" /> * Some scam websites claim to offer free paysafecard PINs under labels such as "promo PSC", luring internet users into subscription traps and [[click fraud]], and not providing any service in return.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.mimikama.at/allgemein/achtung-vor-dieser-kostenlosen-paysafecard/ |title=Achtung vor dieser kostenlosen Paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated --> |date=6 May 2016 |website= |publisher=mimikama.at |access-date=9 May 2018 |quote= |language=German |trans-title=Beware of this free paysafecard }}</ref> Worse versions of this type of scam offer a free "Paysafe generator" and install a ransomware virus.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://sensorstechforum.com/remove-paysafe-generator-virus-restore-cry_-files/ |title=Remove Paysafe Generator Virus and Restore .cry_ Files |last=Bilbao |first=Berta |date=9 November 2016 |website=sensorstechforum.com |access-date=15 May 2018}}</ref> paysafecard sets clear that PINs are only to be entered at authorised online shops, and never to be passed in any other way. The payment method is never used for governmental fines or reminder fees.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.paysafecard.com/en-gb/security/ |title=How to pay securely online with paysafecard |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=paysafecard.com |access-date=28 May 2018}}</ref>
== Awards == From 2009 onwards, paysafecard has won several ''Paybefore Awards'' (since 2016 ''Pay Awards''), issued by the US ''Paybefore'' media group, a daughter of [[Informa]],<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bankingtech-dev.knect365.com/tag/paybefore-awards/# |title=Paybefore Reveals 2017 Pay Awards Winners |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=knect365.com |access-date=April 22, 2018}}</ref> with a focus on prepaid electronic payment solutions. The first of those awards was 2009 ''Best Non-U.S. Prepaid Program''.<ref>{{cite web|title=The Winner’s Circle: Paybefore Announces 2009 Award Winners (February 2009) |publisher=paybefore.com |url=http://paybefore.com/awards/the-winners-circle-paybefore-announces-2009-award-winners-february-2009/ |accessdate=1 February 2016 |date=12 February 2009}}</ref> Other examples include 2012 ''Most Innovative Prepaid Solution Europe''<ref>{{cite web|title=Paybefore Announces Best-in-Category Winners in London (March 2012) |publisher=paybefore.com |url=http://paybefore.com/awards/paybefore-announces-best-in-category-winners-in-london-march-2012/ |accessdate=17 February 2016 |date=20 March 2012 }}</ref> and 2016 ''Best Online or Mobile Commerce Solution''.<ref>{{cite web|title=2016 Pay Awards Winners: Support Your Favorites |publisher=paybefore.com |url=http://paybefore.com/top-stories/2016-pay-awards-winners-support-your-favorites/ |accessdate=26 August 2016 |date=19 January 2016}}</ref>
In the annual contest ''Austria’s Leading Companies'', awarding top businesses in all [[states of Austria]] and the entire republic, paysafecard has won 1st places in Vienna in 2015<ref>{{cite web|title=Die ALC-Bundesland-Sieger 1999–2015 |publisher=[[Wirtschaftsblatt]]|url=http://wirtschaftsblatt.at/home/events/alc/1595551/ |accessdate=26 August 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140602030828/http://wirtschaftsblatt.at/home/events/alc/1595551/ |archivedate=2 June 2014 |language=German}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=ALC 2015: Paysafecard.com will weltweiter Marktführer werden |publisher=[[Wirtschaftsblatt]] |url=http://wirtschaftsblatt.at/home/events/alc/4872587/ALC-2015_Paysafecardcom-will-weltweiter-Marktfuhrer-werden?_vl_backlink=/home/events/alc/index.do |accessdate=17 February 2016 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160122094241/http://wirtschaftsblatt.at/home/events/alc/4872587/ALC-2015_Paysafecardcom-will-weltweiter-Marktfuhrer-werden?_vl_backlink=/home/events/alc/index.do |archivedate=22 January 2016 |date=24 November 2015 |language=German}}</ref> and 2017,<ref>{{cite web|title=ALC, Austria’s Leading Companies – "Die Presse"-SONDERBEILAGE |publisher=diepresse.com |url=https://7coinqmhbl3myqtc495xxs18-wpengine.netdna-ssl.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/3/2017/12/ALC-Sonderbeilage_17_11_gesamt_low.pdf |accessdate=20 December 2017 |date=17 November 2017 |language=German}}</ref> respectively ranking 3rd and 2nd in Austria overall.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://diepresse.com/files/alc/2017/pdf/alc_international_gesamt.pdf |title=Gewinner international |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=diepresse.com |publisher=[[Die Presse]] |access-date=April 22, 2018 |format=PDF |language=German |trans-title=Winners - category 'international'}}</ref>
In the 2018 Austrian ''Great Place to Work'' contest, paysafecard won 1st place in the category ''New Working World and Quality of Living'', as well as 10th place among all medium-sized companies.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.greatplacetowork.at/workplace/item/692/paysafecard.com+Wertkarten+GmbH |title=paysafecard.com Wertkarten GmbH |author=<!-- not stated--> |website=greatplacetowork.at |publisher= |access-date=21 June 2018 |language=German }}</ref>
